pli-tv-kd7:0.3.eng: The chapter on the robe-making ceremony

pli-tv-kd7:0.4.eng: 1. The allowance for a robe-making ceremony

pli-tv-kd7:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd7:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena tiṃsamattā pāveyyakā bhikkhū, sabbe āraññikā sabbe piṇḍapātikā sabbe paṃsukūlikā sabbe tecīvarikā sāvatthiṃ āgacchantā bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upakaṭṭhāya vassūpanāyikāya nāsakkhiṃsu sāvatthiyaṃ vassūpanāyikaṃ sambhāvetuṃ;
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.2.eng: At that time thirty monks from Pāvā—all wilderness dwellers, almsfood-only eaters, rag-robe wearers, and three-robe owners—were traveling to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha. Because the entry to the rainy-season residence was approaching, they were unable to reach Sāvatthī,

pli-tv-kd7:1.1.3.eng: and they entered the rains residence at Sāketa while still on their way.

pli-tv-kd7:1.1.4.pli: Te ukkaṇṭhitarūpā vassaṃ vasiṃsu—āsanneva no bhagavā viharati ito chasu yojanesu, na ca mayaṃ labhāma bhagavantaṃ dassanāyāti.
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.4.eng: They spent the rains residence discontented, thinking, “The Buddha is only 80 kilometers away, yet we don’t get to see him.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.1.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū vassaṃvuṭṭhā, temāsaccayena katāya pavāraṇāya, deve vassante, udakasaṅgahe udakacikkhalle okapuṇṇehi cīvarehi kilantarūpā
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.5.eng: When they had completed the rainy-season residence and done the invitation ceremony at the end of the three months, it was raining, with water and mud everywhere. As they traveled to Sāvatthī, they were exhausted, their robes soaked.

pli-tv-kd7:1.1.6.pli: yena sāvatthi jetavanaṃ anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmo, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd7:1.1.6.eng: When they arrived at Sāvatthī, they went to Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery, bowed to the Buddha, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd7:1.2.1.pli: Āciṇṇaṃ kho panetaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ āgantukehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ paṭisammodituṃ.
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.1.eng: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly-arrived monks,

pli-tv-kd7:1.2.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā te bhikkhū etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd7:1.2.3.eng: “I hope you’re keeping well, monks, I hope you’re getting by?

pli-tv-kd7:1.2.4.pli: kacci samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vasittha, na ca piṇḍakena kilamitthā”ti?
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.4.eng: I hope you had a comfortable rains, that you lived together in peace and harmony, and got almsfood without trouble?”

pli-tv-kd7:1.2.5.eng: “We’re keeping well, sir, we’re getting by.

pli-tv-kd7:1.2.6.pli: samaggā ca mayaṃ, bhante, sammodamānā avivadamānā vassaṃ vasimhā, na ca piṇḍakena kilamimhā.
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.6.eng: We had a comfortable rains, lived together in peace and harmony, and had no trouble getting almsfood.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.2.7.pli: Idha mayaṃ, bhante, tiṃsamattā pāveyyakā bhikkhū sāvatthiṃ āgacchantā bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upakaṭṭhāya vassūpanāyikāya nāsakkhimhā sāvatthiyaṃ vassūpanāyikaṃ sambhāvetuṃ, antarāmagge sākete vassaṃ upagacchimhā.
pli-tv-kd7:1.2.7.eng: They told the Buddha what had happened during the rains and while traveling to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd7:1.2.8.pli: Te mayaṃ, bhante, ukkaṇṭhitarūpā vassaṃ vasimhā—

pli-tv-kd7:1.2.9.pli: ‘āsanneva no bhagavā viharati ito chasu yojanesu, na ca mayaṃ labhāma bhagavantaṃ dassanāyā’ti.

pli-tv-kd7:1.2.10.pli: Atha kho mayaṃ, bhante, vassaṃvuṭṭhā, temāsaccayena katāya pavāraṇāya, deve vassante, udakasaṅgahe udakacikkhalle okapuṇṇehi cīvarehi kilantarūpā addhānaṃ āgatā”ti.

pli-tv-kd7:1.3.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd7:1.3.2.eng: “I allow monks who have completed the rainy-season residence to participate in a robe-making ceremony.
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.2.comm: For an explanation of rendering kathina as “robe-making ceremony”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd7:1.3.3.eng: Once you have participated in the robe-making ceremony, five things are allowable for you:

pli-tv-kd7:1.3.4.pli: anāmantacāro, asamādānacāro, gaṇabhojanaṃ, yāvadatthacīvaraṃ, yo ca tattha cīvaruppādo so nesaṃ bhavissatīti.
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.4.eng: going without informing, going without taking, eating in a group, as much robe-cloth as you need, and whatever robe-cloth is given there is for you.
pli-tv-kd7:1.3.4.comm: For the first four of these five see Bu Pc 46:5.6.1, Bu Np 2:2.39.1, Bu Pc 32:8.15.1, and Bu Np 1:2.17.1 respectively. “Robe-cloth” renders cīvara, for which see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd7:1.3.5.pli: Atthatakathinānaṃ vo, bhikkhave, imāni pañca kappissanti.

pli-tv-kd7:1.3.6.eng: And the robe-making ceremony should be performed like this.

pli-tv-kd7:1.4.1.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd7:1.4.2.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd7:1.4.3.eng: This cloth has been given to the Sangha for the robe-making ceremony.

pli-tv-kd7:1.4.4.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imaṃ kathinadussaṃ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dadeyya kathinaṃ attharituṃ.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.4.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give this cloth to monk so-and-so to perform the robe-making ceremony.

pli-tv-kd7:1.4.6.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd7:1.4.7.eng: This cloth has been given to the Sangha for the robe-making ceremony.

pli-tv-kd7:1.4.8.pli: Saṅgho imaṃ kathinadussaṃ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno deti kathinaṃ attharituṃ.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.8.eng: The Sangha gives this cloth to monk so-and-so to perform the robe-making ceremony.

pli-tv-kd7:1.4.9.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati imassa kathinadussassa itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dānaṃ kathinaṃ attharituṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.9.eng: Any monk who approves of giving this cloth to monk so-and-so to perform the robe-making ceremony should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd7:1.4.10.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd7:1.4.11.pli: Dinnaṃ idaṃ saṅghena kathinadussaṃ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno kathinaṃ attharituṃ.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.11.eng: The Sangha has given this cloth to monk so-and-so to perform the robe-making ceremony.

pli-tv-kd7:1.4.12.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd7:1.4.12.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.1.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, evaṃ anatthataṃ.

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.2.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, anatthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ?
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.2.eng: And, monks, how has the robe-making ceremony not been performed?

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.3.eng: The robe-making ceremony hasn’t been performed merely by marking the cloth,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.3.comm: Sp 3.308: Ullikhitamattenāti dīghato ca puthulato ca pamāṇaggahaṇamattena, “Ullikhitamattena: merely by taking the measure lengthwise or crosswise.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.5.comm: Sp 3.308: Cīvaravicāraṇamattenāti “pañcakaṁ vā sattakaṁ vā navakaṁ vā ekādasakaṁ vā hotū”ti evaṁ vicāritamattena, “Cīvaravicāraṇamattena: merely by planning the robe in this way: let it consist of five, seven, nine, or eleven.” Vmv 3.308 specifies: Pañcakanti pañcakhaṇḍaṁ, “Pañcaka means: five sections.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.7.comm: Sp 3.308: Bandhanamattenāti moghasuttakāropanamattena, “Bandhanamattena: merely by inserting a false thread.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.8.comm: Sp 3.308: Ovaṭṭiyakaraṇamattenāti moghasuttakānusārena dīghasibbitamattena, “Ovaṭṭiyakaraṇamattena: merely by sewing a long seam in conformity with the false thread.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.9.eng: merely by marking with a strip of cloth,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.9.comm: Sp 3.308: Kaṇḍusakaraṇamattenāti muddhiyapattabandhanamattena, “Kaṇḍusakaraṇamattena means merely by fixing a panel for calculating.” Vjb 3.308: Kaṇḍusaṁ nāma pubbabandhana, “Kaṇḍusa is a prior fixing.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.11.eng: merely by adding a border lengthwise,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.11.comm: Sp 3.308: Anuvātakaraṇamattenāti piṭṭhianuvātāropanamattena, “Anuvātakaraṇamattena means merely by mounting a border at the back.” This is further explained at Sp-ṭ 3.308: Piṭṭhianuvātāropanamattenāti dīghato anuvātassa āropanamattena, “Piṭṭhianuvātāropanamattena means merely by mounting a border lengthwise.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.12.eng: merely by adding a border crosswise,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.12.comm: Sp 3.308: Paribhaṇḍakaraṇamattenāti kucchianauvātāropanamattena, “Paribhaṇḍakaraṇamattena means merely by mounting a border at the belly.” This is further explained at Sp-ṭ 3.308: Kucchianuvātāropanamattenāti puthulato anuvātassa āropanamattena, “Kucchianuvātāropanamattena means merely by adding a border crosswise.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.13.comm: Sp 3.308: Ovaddheyyakaraṇamattenāti āgantukapattāropanamattena; kathinacīvarato vā pattaṁ gahetvā aññasmiṁ akathinacīvare pattāropanamattena, “Ovaddheyyakaraṇamattena: merely by adding a panel to an external (robe); having taken a panel from the cloth for the robe-making ceremony, then adding it to another robe, which is not the cloth for the robe-making ceremony.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.14.comm: Sp 3.308: Kambalamaddanamattenāti ekavāraṁyeva rajane pakkhittena dantavaṇṇena paṇḍupalāsavaṇṇena vā, “Kambalamaddanamattena: dyeing it just once by putting it into the color of ivory or beige.” The implication seems to be that the kathina ceremony can be done by a process of proper dyeing. Sp 3.308: Sace pana sakiṁ vā dvikkhattuṁ vā rattampi sāruppaṁ hoti, vaṭṭati, “But if it is suitably dyed, once or twice, it is allowable.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.15.eng: nor has it been performed if a monk has made an indication,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.15.comm: Sp 3.308: Nimittakatenāti “‘iminā dussena kathinaṁ attharissāmī’ti evaṁ nimittakatena. Ettakameva hi parivāre vuttaṁ. Aṭṭhakathāsu pana ‘ayaṁ sāṭako sundaro, sakkā iminā kathinaṁ attharitu’nti evaṁ nimittakammaṁ katvā laddhenā”ti vuttaṁ, “Nimittakatena: it is said in the Compendium that it means making an indication in this way: ‘I will do the robe-making ceremony with this cloth.’ But it is said in the commentaries that it is by obtaining (a robe) after making an indication in this way: ‘This cloth is beautiful; it is possible to do the robe-making ceremony with it.’”

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.16.eng: if a monk has given a hint,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.16.comm: Sp 3.308: Parikathākatenāti “kathinaṁ nāma dātuṁ vaṭṭati, kathinadāyako bahuṁ puññaṁ pasavatī”ti evaṁ parikathāya uppāditena, “Parikathākatena: by one who causes it to be given by hinting in this way: ‘It is allowable to give a cloth for the robe-making ceremony; one who gives this makes much merit.’”

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.17.eng: if the robe-cloth has been borrowed,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.17.comm: Sp 3.308: Kukkukatenāti tāvakālikena, “Kukkukatena: with one that is borrowed.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.19.eng: if it is to be relinquished,

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.20.comm: For the meaning of akappakatena see Bu Pc 58:2.1.2.

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.21.pli: na aññatra saṅghāṭiyā atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.21.eng: if it’s not an outer robe

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.22.pli: na aññatra uttarāsaṅgena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ,

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.23.pli: na aññatra antaravāsakena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ,

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.24.pli: na aññatra pañcakena vā atirekapañcakena vā tadaheva sañchinnena samaṇḍalīkatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.24.eng: nor has it been performed if the robe hasn’t been made on that very day with five or more cut sections with panels,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.24.comm: Sp 3.308 explains pañcakena vā atirekapañcakena vā, “five or more”, as pañca vā atirekāni vā khaṇḍāni, “five or more sections”. Each section is made up of a large panel (maṇḍala) and a medium-sized panel (aḍḍhamaṇḍala) with a strip (aḍḍhakusi) in between. In this case maṇḍala seems to be used as an umbrella term for both maṇḍala and aḍḍhamaṇḍala. Sp 3.308: Mahāmaṇḍalaaḍḍhamaṇḍalāni dassetvā, “Showing large panels and medium-sized panels.” See also Kd 8:12.2.3.

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.25.pli: na aññatra puggalassa atthārā atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ;
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.25.eng: if the robe-making ceremony wasn’t performed by an individual,
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.25.comm: Sp 3.308: Aññatra puggalassa atthārāti puggalassa atthāraṁ ṭhapetvā na aññena saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā atthārena atthataṁ hoti, “Aññatra puggalassa atthārā: apart from an individual performing it, there is no other performing it by a sangha or by a group.” The performing, literally, “spreading”, does not refer to the making of the robe, but to the declaration made when the robe is complete. Sp 3.306: Katapariyositaṁ pana kathinaṁ gahetvā atthārakena bhikkhunā “sace saṅghāṭiyā kathinaṁ attharitukāmo hoti, porāṇikā saṅghāṭi paccuddharitabbā, navā saṅghāṭi adhiṭṭhātabbā, ‘Imāya saṅghāṭiyā kathinaṁ attharāmī’ti vācā bhinditabbā”tiādinā parivāre vuttavidhānena kathinaṁ attharitabbaṁ, “By the monk who is performing the ceremony, having taken the completed kathina (robe), the kathina ceremony is performed by the ceremony spoken of in the Compendium: ‘If he wants to perform the kathina ceremony with an outer robe, he should first relinquish his old outer robe and determine the new one, and then say, “I perform the kathina ceremony with this outer robe”’, etc.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.26.pli: sammā ce atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, tañce nissīmaṭṭho anumodati, evampi anatthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ.
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.26.eng: or if the robe-making ceremony has been performed correctly but the appreciation for the ceremony was expressed outside the monastery zone.
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.26.comm: Sp 3.306 explains the appreciation as follows: Tehi anumodakehi bhikkhūhi ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā añjaliṁ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo – “atthataṁ āvuso saṅghassa kathinaṁ, dhammiko kathinatthāro, anumodāmā”ti evamādinā parivāre vuttavidhāneneva anumodāpetabbaṁ, “The expression of appreciation is to be done by the ceremony spoken of in the Compendium, thus: the monks who express their appreciation should put their upper robe over one shoulder, put the palms of their hands together, and say this: ‘The kathina ceremony has been done by the Sangha, it is legitimate, we express our appreciation.’” “Monastery zone” renders sīmā. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd7:1.5.27.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, anatthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ.
pli-tv-kd7:1.5.27.eng: In this way the robe-making ceremony hasn’t been performed.

pli-tv-kd7:1.6.1.eng: And how has the robe-making ceremony been performed?

pli-tv-kd7:1.6.2.pli: Ahatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, ahatakappena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, pilotikāya atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, paṃsukūlena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, pāpaṇikena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, animittakatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, aparikathākatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, akukkukatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, asannidhikatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, anissaggiyena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, kappakatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, saṅghāṭiyā atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, uttarāsaṅgena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, antaravāsakena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, pañcakena vā atirekapañcakena vā tadaheva sañchinnena samaṇḍalīkatena atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, puggalassa atthārā atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ; sammā ce atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ, tañce sīmaṭṭho anumodati, evampi atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ.
pli-tv-kd7:1.6.2.eng: The robe-making ceremony has been performed if the cloth is brand new, if it’s nearly new, if it’s old, if it’s a rag, if it’s from a shop; it has been performed if a monk hasn’t made an indication, if a monk hasn’t given a hint, if the robe-cloth hasn’t been borrowed, if it hasn’t been stored, if it’s not to be relinquished, if it has been marked, if it’s an outer robe or an upper robe or a sarong; it has been performed if the robe has been made on that very day with five or more cut sections with panels, if the robe-making ceremony was performed by an individual, if the robe-making ceremony has been performed correctly and if the appreciation for the ceremony was expressed inside the monastery zone.
pli-tv-kd7:1.6.2.comm: Sp 3.309: Ahatenāti aparibhuttena, “Ahatena: not used.” Sp 3.309: Ahatakappenāti ahatasadisena ekavāraṁ vā dvikkhattuṁ vā dhotena, “Ahatakappena: similar to one that is brand new; washed once or twice.” Sp 3.309: Pilotikāyāti hatavatthakasāṭakena, “Pilotikāya: a used robe-cloth.”

pli-tv-kd7:1.6.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atthataṃ hoti kathinaṃ.
pli-tv-kd7:1.6.3.eng: In this way the robe-making ceremony has been performed.

pli-tv-kd7:1.7.1.eng: And how does the robe season come to an end?

pli-tv-kd7:1.7.2.eng: There are these eight key phrases for when the robe season ends:

pli-tv-kd7:1.7.3.pli: pakkamanantikā, niṭṭhānantikā, sanniṭṭhānantikā, nāsanantikā, savanantikā, āsāvacchedikā, sīmātikkantikā, sahubbhārā”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:1.7.3.eng: when he departs from the monastery, when the robe is finished, when he makes a decision, when the robe-cloth is lost, when he hears about the end of the robe season, when an expectation of more robe-cloth is disappointed, when he is outside the monastery zone, ending together.”

pli-tv-kd7:2.1.1.pli: Bhikkhu atthatakathino katacīvaraṃ ādāya pakkamati—“na paccessan”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.1.eng: A monk who has participated in the robe-making ceremony takes a finished robe and leaves the monastery, thinking, “I won’t return.”

pli-tv-kd7:2.1.2.eng: For that monk the robe season ends when he departs from the monastery.

pli-tv-kd7:2.1.3.eng: A monk who has participated in the robe-making ceremony takes robe-cloth and leaves the monastery.

pli-tv-kd7:2.1.4.pli: Tassa bahisīmagatassa evaṃ hoti—“idhevimaṃ cīvaraṃ kāressaṃ, na paccessan”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.4.eng: When he is outside the monastery zone, he thinks, “I’ll make the robe right here. I won’t return.”

pli-tv-kd7:2.1.5.eng: He then has the robe made.

pli-tv-kd7:2.1.6.eng: For that monk the robe season ends when the robe is finished.

pli-tv-kd7:2.1.7.eng: A monk who has participated in the robe-making ceremony takes robe-cloth and leaves the monastery.

pli-tv-kd7:2.1.8.pli: Tassa bahisīmagatassa evaṃ hoti—“nevimaṃ cīvaraṃ kāressaṃ, na paccessan”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.8.eng: When he is outside the monastery zone, he thinks, “I won’t make a robe, and I won’t return.”

pli-tv-kd7:2.1.9.eng: For that monk the robe season ends when he makes that decision.

pli-tv-kd7:2.1.10.eng: A monk who has participated in the robe-making ceremony takes robe-cloth and leaves the monastery.

pli-tv-kd7:2.1.11.pli: Tassa bahisīmagatassa evaṃ hoti—“idhevimaṃ cīvaraṃ kāressaṃ, na paccessan”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:2.1.11.eng: When he is outside the monastery zone, he thinks, “I’ll make the robe right here. I won’t return.”

pli-tv-kd7:2.1.12.pli: So taṃ cīvaraṃ kāreti. Tassa taṃ cīvaraṃ kayiramānaṃ nassati.

pli-tv-kd7:9.3.13.eng: For that monk the robe season ends while he is outside the monastery zone.

pli-tv-kd7:9.3.14.eng: A monk who has participated in the robe-making ceremony leaves the monastery while expecting more robe-cloth, thinking, “I’ll return.”

pli-tv-kd7:10.3.23.eng: The group of twelve on business is finished.

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.0.eng: 12. The group of nine on “without taking”

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.1.pli: Bhikkhu atthatakathino disaṅgamiko pakkamati cīvarapaṭivīsaṃ apavilāyamāno.
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.1.eng: A monk who has participated in the robe-making ceremony leaves the monastery for a different region without taking his share of robe-cloth.

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.2.pli: Tamenaṃ disaṅgataṃ bhikkhū pucchanti—“kahaṃ tvaṃ, āvuso, vassaṃvuṭṭho, kattha ca te cīvarapaṭivīso”ti?
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.2.eng: When he has gone to that region, the monks there ask him, “Where did you complete the rains residence? Where’s your share of robe-cloth?”

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.3.pli: So evaṃ vadeti—“amukasmiṃ āvāse vassaṃvuṭṭhomhi. Tattha ca me cīvarapaṭivīso”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.3.eng: He replies, “I completed the rains residence in such-and-such a monastery. That’s where my share of robe-cloth is.”

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.4.pli: Te evaṃ vadanti—“gacchāvuso, taṃ cīvaraṃ āhara, mayaṃ te idha cīvaraṃ karissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.4.eng: They say, “Go and get that robe-cloth, and we’ll make a robe for you.”

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.5.pli: So taṃ āvāsaṃ gantvā bhikkhū pucchati—“kahaṃ me, āvuso, cīvarapaṭivīso”ti?

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.6.pli: Te evaṃ vadanti—“ayaṃ te, āvuso, cīvarapaṭivīso; kahaṃ gamissasī”ti?
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.6.eng: They reply, “This is your share. Where are you going?”

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.7.pli: So evaṃ vadeti—“amukaṃ nāma āvāsaṃ gamissāmi, tattha me bhikkhū cīvaraṃ karissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.7.eng: He says, “I’m going to such-and-such a monastery. The monks there will make me a robe.”

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.8.pli: Te evaṃ vadanti—“alaṃ, āvuso, mā agamāsi. Mayaṃ te idha cīvaraṃ karissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.8.eng: They say, “There’s no need to go. We’ll make a robe for you here.”

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.9.pli: Tassa evaṃ hoti—“idhevimaṃ cīvaraṃ kāressaṃ, na paccessan”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.9.eng: He thinks, “I’ll make the robe right here. I won’t return.”
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.9.comm: Presumably this means he will leave the monastery once the robe is finished and not return before the end of the robe season.

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.10.eng: He then has the robe made.

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.11.eng: For that monk the robe season ends when the robe is finished.

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.12.eng: A monk who has participated in the robe-making ceremony leaves the monastery for a different region …

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.13.eng: “I won’t make a robe, and I won’t return.”

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.14.eng: For that monk the robe season ends when he makes that decision.

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.16.eng: “I’ll make the robe right here. I won’t return.”

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.17.pli: So taṃ cīvaraṃ kāreti. Tassa taṃ cīvaraṃ kayiramānaṃ nassati.
pli-tv-kd7:11.1.17.eng: He then has the robe made, but it is lost while being made.

pli-tv-kd7:11.1.18.eng: For that monk the robe season ends when the robe-cloth is lost.

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.0.eng: 13. The group of five on “meditation going well”

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.1.pli: Bhikkhu atthatakathino phāsuvihāriko cīvaraṃ ādāya pakkamati—
pli-tv-kd7:12.1.1.eng: A monk who has participated in the robe-making ceremony and whose meditation is going well takes his robe-cloth and leaves the monastery, thinking,
pli-tv-kd7:12.1.1.comm: “Whose meditation is going well” renders phāsuvihārika. Vihāra is a common Sutta term for a state of meditation, as in diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāra, “a happy (meditation) abiding in this very life”, which is a reference to the four absorptions. Phāsu means “comfortable” or “at ease”. Although this may be understood quite broadly, it seems likely that meditation would be the main connotation.

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.3.pli: tattha me phāsu bhavissati vasissāmi, no ce me phāsu bhavissati, amukaṃ nāma āvāsaṃ gamissāmi;
pli-tv-kd7:12.1.3.eng: If my meditation goes well there, I’ll stay. If not, I’ll go to such-and-such a monastery.

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.4.pli: tattha me phāsu bhavissati vasissāmi, no ce me phāsu bhavissati, amukaṃ nāma āvāsaṃ gamissāmi;
pli-tv-kd7:12.1.4.eng: If my meditation goes well there, I’ll stay. If not, I’ll go to such-and-such a monastery.

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.5.pli: tattha me phāsu bhavissati vasissāmi, no ce me phāsu bhavissati, paccessan”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:12.1.5.eng: If my meditation goes well there, I’ll stay. If not, I’ll return.”

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.6.pli: Tassa bahisīmagatassa evaṃ hoti—“idhevimaṃ cīvaraṃ kāressaṃ, na paccessan”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:12.1.6.eng: When he is outside the monastery zone, he thinks, “I’ll make the robe right here. I won’t return.”

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.7.eng: He then has the robe made.

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.8.eng: For that monk the robe season ends when the robe is finished.

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.31.eng: If my meditation goes well there, I’ll stay. If not, I’ll go to such-and-such a monastery.

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.32.pli: tattha me phāsu bhavissati vasissāmi, no ce me phāsu bhavissati, amukaṃ nāma āvāsaṃ gamissāmi;
pli-tv-kd7:12.1.32.eng: If my meditation goes well there, I’ll stay. If not, I’ll go to such-and-such a monastery.

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.33.pli: tattha me phāsu bhavissati vasissāmi, no ce me phāsu bhavissati, paccessan”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:12.1.33.eng: If my meditation goes well there, I’ll stay. If not, I’ll return.”

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.34.eng: When he is outside the monastery zone, he has a robe made.

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.35.eng: When the robe has been made, he still thinks, “I’ll return,” and they reach the end of the robe season together.

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.36.eng: For that monk the robe season ends together with the other monks.

pli-tv-kd7:12.1.37.eng: The group of five on “meditation going well” is finished.

pli-tv-kd7:13.1.0.eng: 14. Discussion on obstacles and removal of obstacles

pli-tv-kd7:13.1.1.pli: Dveme, bhikkhave, kathinassa palibodhā, dve apalibodhā.
pli-tv-kd7:13.1.1.eng: “Monks, there are two obstacles for the ending of the robe season:

pli-tv-kd7:13.1.2.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, dve kathinassa palibodhā?

pli-tv-kd7:13.1.3.eng: the monastery obstacle and the robe obstacle.

pli-tv-kd7:13.1.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vasati vā tasmiṃ āvāse, sāpekkho vā pakkamati “paccessan”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:13.1.5.eng: A monk stays in that monastery or he leaves intending to return.

pli-tv-kd7:13.1.8.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cīvaraṃ akataṃ vā hoti vippakataṃ vā, cīvarāsā vā anupacchinnā.
pli-tv-kd7:13.1.8.eng: A monk hasn’t made a robe, or he hasn’t finished it, or he’s expecting more robe-cloth.

pli-tv-kd7:13.1.10.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve kathinassa palibodhā.

pli-tv-kd7:13.2.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, dve kathinassa apalibodhā?
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.1.eng: There are two removals of obstacles for the ending of the robe season:

pli-tv-kd7:13.2.2.eng: the removal of the monastery obstacle and the removal of the robe obstacle.

pli-tv-kd7:13.2.3.eng: What’s the removal of the monastery obstacle?

pli-tv-kd7:13.2.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pakkamati tamhā āvāsā cattena vantena muttena anapekkho “na paccessan”ti.
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.4.eng: A monk leaves that monastery without intending to return.

pli-tv-kd7:13.2.6.eng: What’s the removal of the robe obstacle?

pli-tv-kd7:13.2.7.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cīvaraṃ kataṃ vā hoti, naṭṭhaṃ vā vinaṭṭhaṃ vā daḍḍhaṃ vā, cīvarāsā vā upacchinnā.
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.7.eng: A monk has made a robe; or the robe-cloth is lost, destroyed, or burned; or his expectation of more robe-cloth is disappointed.”

pli-tv-kd7:13.2.9.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve kathinassa apalibodhā”ti.

pli-tv-kd7:13.2.10.eng: The seventh chapter on the robe-making ceremony is finished.

pli-tv-kd7:13.2.124.pli: Imamhi khandhake vatthū doḷasakapeyyālamukhāni ekasataṃ aṭṭhārasa.
pli-tv-kd7:13.2.124.eng: In this chapter there are one hundred and eighteen topics by means of groups of twelve with repetition.

pli-tv-kd7:13.2.125.eng: The chapter on the robe-making ceremony is finished.
